name: Introduction to Programming
description: This course introduces students to the concepts of programming. Students will learn how to write simple programs using an iterative process, conditional statements, and functions.

name: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental techniques for designing and analyzing algorithms. Students will learn about common data structures, sorting and searching algorithms, and graph algorithms.

name: Digital Logic and Computer Architecture
description: This course introduces students to the principles of digital logic design and computer architecture. Students will learn about combinational and sequential logic circuits, CPU architecture, memory hierarchy, and input/output.

name: Operating Systems
description: This course introduces students to the principles of operating systems. Students will learn about process management, memory management, file systems, and virtualization.

name: Computer Networks
description: This course introduces students to the principles of computer networks. Students will learn about the TCP/IP protocol stack, network architecture, routing, congestion control, and security.

name: Databases
description: This course introduces students to the principles of databases. Students will learn about relational database design, SQL, transaction management, and indexing.

name: Programming Languages
description: This course introduces students to the principles of programming language design and implementation. Students will learn about syntax and semantics, scoping and binding, type systems, and program optimization.

name: Computer Graphics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of computer graphics. Students will learn about the 2D and 3D graphics pipeline, transformations, rasterization, shading, and texturing.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: This course introduces students to the principles of artificial intelligence. Students will learn about search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning, and natural language processing.

name: Software Engineering
description: This course introduces students to the principles of software engineering. Students will learn about software design patterns, program testing, version control, and project management.

name: Embedded Systems
description: This course introduces students to the principles of embedded systems. Students will learn about microcontrollers, sensors and actuators, real-time operating systems, and embedded system design.

name: Computer Security
description: This course introduces students to the principles of computer security. Students will learn about cryptography, access control, network security, and software security.

name: Computer Vision
description: This course introduces students to the principles of computer vision. Students will learn about image processing, pattern recognition, object recognition, and computer vision applications.
